bug.author: liusheng
bug.summary: no matches for kind "VirtualService" error occur when deploy kubeflow
bug.description: I have deployed a k8s cluster by with version , and then try to deploy kubeflow follow the <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/getting-started-k8s/>guide documentation</denchmark-link> , when I run , I got the error: <denchmark-code>ERRO[0196] (Will retry) Component centraldashboard apply failed; Error: handle object: patching object from cluster: merging object with existing state: unable to recognize "/tmp/ksonnet-mergepatch733127502": no matches for kind "VirtualService" in version "networking.istio.io/v1alpha3" filename="ksonnet/ksonnet.go:174" </denchmark-code>

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.88. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Are you deploying from master? Master requires ISTIO. Did you install ISTIO in your cluster?

Per <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/issues/3159>#3159</denchmark-link> it looks like kfctl on v0.5.0 may be using manifests on master by default. You might need to to pass --version=v0.5.0 to kctl init
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> yes, thanks :) I have added to kctl init to make this issue fixed.
I am hitting this error with kfctl version kfctl v0.6.2-0-g47a0e4c7 can you please advise?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cyrilthank>@cyrilthank</denchmark-link> Please open a new issue since you are using a different version of Kubeflow its a different issue. Please include the commands you ran and the log output.
